definition: to hold things up/to make a botch of things

sentences.english: Judging by appearances can be misleading.
sentences.chinese: 凭外表判断是会误事的。

sentences.english: For the sake of your health, please don't drink too much wine.
sentences.chinese: 杯中之物不要多饮，否则既伤身体也容易误事。

sentences.english: Country must be messy in his hands.
sentences.chinese: 国家在他手里一定会误事的。

sentences.english: I only wanted to help, and forgot that more people would delay it in turn.
sentences.chinese: 我一心只想帮忙，忘记了人多反而误事。

definition: to go wrong/to get into trouble
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
after drinking/under the influence of alcohol
to take a wrong turn/to go wrong
to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
greedy for sex/given to lust for women
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
